annotation.TEXT: Score! Now everyone's OCD will be satisfied! But, am I actually a true lunatic? ...I think most (if not all) of us should know the answer to that.
Demo count: 3
Oh, BTW, if you fell down here without getting the power up from these note blocks, and you're small, you can get the super mushroom the same way as the 1-up here.
Yeah, this is really weird. Were the creator(s) of the Base ROM planning to do something with the YSP, but stopped partway into it?
So, this allows the stuff I hid behind those 1-up checkpoint objects to appear. Anyway, it looks like I dawdled too much with what I wanted to use that silver P-switch for.
Alright, I tried to be fancy there, but it didn't work. Anyway, you might be wondering why this silver P-switch is here now, when it wasn't there to begin with.
So, let me just...
HARRY UP!
Alright, before I end the video, there's one last thing I'm gonna show, and it's in Same Ol' YI2.
In addition, there are some switch palace blocks here too, so they can help. Or, you can try to do this part without any of those assists at all, which is certainly possible!
Unfortunately, the ceiling there prevents me from just bouncing straight from Dry Bones to the coin. However, if I grab the ice block he's on while he's collapsed...
What the french toast?!
Okay, now over here is a blue Koopa and a ? block. Gee, I wonder what I should do...
That's all that P-switch is really for, although you can also use it for other things if you wanted, I guess. However, the other blue P-switch is likely more convenient for those.
However, I'm not going to actually enter that pipe myself since I'm low on time. Now, up here... what could this place be for?
So, it should be blatantly obvious by now what this silver P-switch is for.
Goal tape average: 56 / 2 = 28 stars each.
So, in that case, you'd have to play the whole level for the normal exit anyway. Okay, now I'm gonna try something else in YSP here...
Well, hit this P-switch here, and...
And then, just go back to the left and put the key in the keyhole.
Just gotta deal with the last few enemies. Attacking them with ice blocks might be a good idea, especially for the Manner Bro.
If you're super, and you duck and spin jump just right, you can actually reach the goal and clear the level. Still, I wonder who altered the YSP like this in the Base ROM?
Of course, since I've already triggered the checkpoint 1-up, it won't appear as I fall down this shaft here this time.
Demo count: 1
Go, my nonexistent blocks, and fill the world with your nonexistent-ness!
GAAAMMMEEE!!! Okay, how did I even manage to toss the P-switch into the ceiling like that?
Okay, this is totally weird. This level was like this in the Base ROM to begin with, and I didn't change anything other than the music.
Demo count: 4
Oh, come on. That ice block totally hit the guy. Well, whatever. BTW, if you're a completionist, be sure to check out this pipe.
Space-time rewind count: 1
And yeah, this room is part of the same sublevel as that room where I slide-killed stuff earlier.
And yes, I saw cutoff there, so this hack's not gonna be accepted at SMW Central! (Just kidding!)
There we go. Get as far left as you can, then duck and spin jump while holding right, and that may allow you to get out of there and hit the goal.
Quite simple, and I only had to redo a tiny portion of the level to get this secret exit, thanks to the 1-up checkpoint trick.
Aha! Now I can go further to the right! ...But not too much further...
Anyway, we have this silver P-switch here, which wasn't here initially.
4-life combo!
Alright, that'll do it for this episode. But, what about the moon? And, are there other secrets to be found? Find out next time! To be continued... Yo!
Hmm... There's the last Yoshi coin, but it's trapped behind several turn blocks. Whatever shall I do? Well, it is possible to maybe force/glitch your way through them...
Whoops! Not what I meant to show. If you enter here big, and press left or down before jumping, you die instantly.
BTW, if you manage to obtain the key by getting the blue Koopa to catch an ice block, you will not trigger the checkpoint 1-up there this way.
Sweet! And, hopefully, you've collected at least 30 coins by this point, so that you'll get another 1-up! Oh, and BTW, you can't enter that green pipe there. It's exit only.
3-life combo!
Oh, what's this?
What if, after initially bringing a silver P-switch here, I had decided to go straight for the secret exit first?
And, once I triggered that checkpoint 1-up, the game would no longer load any 1-up checkpoint objects in this level, until I reset or power off the game.
Push!
Awesome combo! (8 hits, 16,400 points and 1 life)
Goal tape average: 40 / 1 = 40 stars each.
Here's another room that shares the same sublevel as that slide-kill room. So, let's take a look around.
Over here is a power up and another multi-coin block that I'm not going to hit too much. (I'd totally try to block factory it if it wasn't for the ZSNES crash risk, though.)
To get down from here safely, just utilize the Hammer Bro. platform like this. (I wouldn't just leave you with a totally blind jump here.)
Well, remember that checkpoint 1-up I triggered early in the outside section? Well, I hid that silver P-switch block (and the green coins) behind 1-up checkpoint objects.
So, there you go. That's both exits. But, wait! What if I had done things differently?
Hello! Last time, I left off here in Ice Block Cavern! Now, let's get past these munchers by stomping this silver P-switch!
...nope! Because, I put a checkpoint 1-up here as well, which you'll most likely trigger if you go for the key with a silver P-switch before heading towards the normal exit.
Huh... I wonder if there's anything of interest up there... Nah, I just put those bushes there for decoration. Pay them no mind. Really.
Alright, let's resume the level here.
Yep, I had to include a ⑨ in my VLDC⑨ level somewhere! (BTW, this was like a last-minute addition to the level. Before then, this region was all open sky.)
So, unless you move in some weird way to screw up the order of the invisible 1-up checkpoint objects there, you should almost definitely trigger it this way.
Alright, back out here, let's properly get that blue Koopa to kick an ice block at that ? block.
Yep, this is actually how you're supposed to get the key, instead of trying to get that incompetent blue Koopa to catch an ice block.
Huh, I wonder why the music is back to normal speed? I just realized that now. Anyway, we're on the home stretch here.
Ah, it's a star, which is one of the many ways you can deal with this next section. You could also use the earlier blue P-switch to turn the coins there into a bridge.
Also, if you enter here small, you're totally stuck. Fortunately, I have a reserve power up.
Hmm... This room appears to have an interesting setup. Okay, so let's see if I can get the blue duder back to the left to kick an ice block for me...
Actually, that was totally on purpose, since I'm sure that in the full VLDC9 hack, power ups will be removed upon returning to the map, so I was just being fair here. Yep.
Okay, now let's see if I can end up on the right side of this wall. Maybe if I go as far right as I can, then duck and spin jump while holding left...
3-life combo!
And yes, I ask the player not to bring Yoshi into Ice Block Cavern. I don't think he'd function well there anyway, since you have to carry some P-switches through pipes.
BTW, I didn't set the timer to start at 712, because there was anonymous judging for this contest, and I felt that 712 might've given away my identity.
Wait, did I just type "Manner Bro." there? That's wrong. I meant Hammer Bro.! (Manner Bro. would be the guy that says things like "Please", "Thank you", & "You're welcome".)
Now, unlike my past VLDC levels, this level only contains 5 Yoshi coins, not 7. So, yeah, that's it for them. (I couldn't make 7 Yoshi coins work well with this level's setup.)
Alright, let me quickly return to Ice Block Cavern so that I can go for the secret exit.
BTW, in case you really screw things up, you can enter this green pipe to come out of the exit-only green pipe in the bonus room I was just in, which will reset this area.
Also, while the P-switch is active, quickly jump onto these coins over here while they're blocks and then jump up against the wall to find a hidden 1-up.
Okay, time's just about up here, so I'd better finish quickly. Fortunately, the goal's right here.
The coin under that arch ledge will turn into a block, and the Chuck in there should run into it and jump up, where you can then easily get him to break the turn blocks for you!
...Yep, the silver P-switch is here now, and can be used to quickly head in the normal exit's direction.
I wouldn't end up triggering the checkpoint 1-up in the outside area, so the hidden silver P-switch at the start won't show itself.
Finish! ...With just 2 seconds left! Wow, I'm glad I had set the starting time limit to 700, despite me initially thinking that 500 would've been enough.
But, there is a better way. Open up this block up here to reveal a blue P-switch, and hit it.
Ooh, dropping down that shaft made a 1-up appear, but it landed on the note blocks. However, you can hit the note blocks from below to try and get it to come on down!
Well, regardless of whether I'm a true lunatic or not, I'd better collect that coin to satisfy everyone's OCD. However, it's too high to just jump to. Maybe Dry Bones can help?
However, if you're already big, just go back to the left and jump through the rope near the entrance to this area and climb up again.
Anyway, enough fooling around. Let me ludicrously speed back to Ice Block Cavern.
Demo count: 2
If you got the star, take this lower path to add more to your kill combo. Otherwise, use an ice block to hit that vine block.
Yes, that ludicrous speed was totally necessary. Now, since I triggered that checkpoint 1-up while getting the secret exit...
That was a demo. Yep, that's what it was. (IDK what happened to my fireball, but my slide was stopped by the edge of the screen.)
Well, not that, obviously. But, it doesn't matter, since I want to check out this pipe first.
(Note: It's rare for this to happen, but it's possible for the kicked ice block to miss one of the Parakoopas in that kill combo, gypping you out of a 1-up.)
Fortunately, going through a pipe will reset the area, including the silver P-switch at the start, so I can just get it again and do this right this time.
Well, the answer to that is...
Okay, so that's the normal exit, which leads to the Yellow Switch Palace (which I've named "Thanks for playing!"). However, there's something I want to show in there.
So, would I have to repeat the whole level for the normal exit afterwards?
D'oh. That was a dumb hit, but not to worry, as there's another power up in these note blocks here.
Yes, it's the Yoshi rescue message, which I changed.
Push!
